security_audit.summary: This skill contains pure Python data structure implementations for memory systems. No network calls, no external file system access, no command execution, no environment variable reading. All operations are in-memory. The code provides VectorStore, PropertyGraph, and TemporalKnowledgeGraph classes for building AI agent memory. Behavior matches stated purpose exactly.

content.value_statement: AI agents lose all context when sessions end. This skill provides implementations for vector stores, knowledge graphs, and temporal knowledge graphs that enable persistent, structured memory across conversations.
actual_capabilities: Implement in-memory vector store with semantic search
Build property graph for entity relationships
Create temporal knowledge graph with validity periods
Retrieve memories by entity, time range, or semantic similarity
Design multi-layer memory architecture from context to permanent storage
Integrate memory systems with context windows
limitations: No built-in persistence to disk or database
Embeddings use random generation instead of actual model
Memory is session-scoped and lost on restart
No native support for concurrent access or distributed deployment

use_cases.title: Build Persistent Agents
use_cases.description: Create AI agents that remember user preferences and conversation history across sessions.

use_cases.title: Enhance Vector Search
use_cases.description: Add entity indexing and temporal filtering to improve retrieval accuracy and recency.

use_cases.title: Model Entity Relationships
use_cases.description: Build knowledge graphs that track relationships between entities over time.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Memory Setup
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to add memory to my AI agent so it can remember information across conversations. Help me design a memory architecture that includes short-term and long-term layers.

prompt_templates.title: Knowledge Graph
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a knowledge graph implementation that tracks entities and their relationships. Include the ability to query connected entities and traverse relationships.

prompt_templates.title: Temporal Queries
prompt_templates.prompt: Extend the knowledge graph to support temporal validity. I need to query what was true at a specific point in time and track how entities changed over time.

prompt_templates.title: Memory Integration
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a system that retrieves relevant memories and injects them into the context window. Include strategies for prioritizing recent and important memories.

output_examples.input: How do I implement memory for my Claude agent so it remembers user preferences across sessions?
output: - Use vector store for semantic retrieval of past conversations
- Add property graph to track entity relationships and user preferences
- Implement temporal validity to handle changing information
- Store memories in session-persistent database or file system
- Retrieve relevant memories just-in-time when needed
- Limit context injection to attention-favored positions

best_practices: Match memory architecture to query requirements (vector for similarity, graph for relationships)
Implement progressive disclosure showing only relevant memories in context
Use temporal validity periods to prevent outdated information conflicts
Consolidate memories periodically to remove duplicates and outdated facts
anti_patterns: Storing everything in context without filtering (causes context overflow)
Using only vector search without relationship tracking (loses connection structure)
Ignoring temporal validity (results in conflicting outdated information)
Loading all memories at once instead of just-in-time retrieval

faq.question: Does this work with Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill provides Python implementations that integrate with any AI agent framework including Claude Code.

faq.question: What memory types are supported?
faq.answer: Vector stores, property graphs, temporal knowledge graphs, and integrated multi-layer memory systems.

faq.question: How do I persist memories between sessions?
faq.answer: The implementation provides in-memory storage. For persistence, serialize to JSON or use a database like SQLite or Neo4j.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: This skill runs locally. No data leaves your environment. All memory operations happen in your own code.

faq.question: Why use knowledge graphs over vector stores?
faq.answer: Knowledge graphs preserve relationships between entities enabling queries like 'find related entities' that vector stores cannot answer.

faq.question: How is this different from standard RAG?
faq.answer: Agent memory tracks entities across interactions, maintains identity over time, and supports temporal queries about past states.
